comments.body: I think the description for AuthOptions should have the @beta tag.

```suggestion
     * This setting is only applicable to custom functions running on Excel on the web.
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +80,84 @@    /**
     * Optional parameter that determines whether the dialog box displays as a popup (false) or within an IFrame (true).
     * This setting is only applicable to custom functions running on Excel Online.
     */
    displayInIFrame?: boolean;

comments.body:
```suggestion
   * Provides options for the user experience when Office obtains an access token to the add-in from Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) v. 2.0 with the getAccessToken method.
```

```suggestion
     * The prompt will only allow consent to the Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) profile scope, not to any Microsoft Graph scopes.
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +120,124 @@     * If set to false, Office will silently try to get an access token. If it fails to do so, Office will return a descriptive error.
     * If set to true, Office will show an interactive consent UI after it fails to silently get an access token.
     * The prompt will only allow consent to the AAD profile scope, not to any Microsoft Graph scopes.
     */
    allowConsentPrompt?: boolean;

comments.body:
```suggestion
     * Causes Office to return descriptive error when the add-in wants to access MS Graph and the user/admin has not granted consent to Microsoft Graph scopes.
```

```suggestion
     * Calls the Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) V 2.0 endpoint to get an access token to your add-in's web application. Enables add-ins to identify users.
```
